basics.name: Deborah Dore
basics.label: PhD Student in Natural Language Processing
basics.summary: PhD candidate at CNRS focusing on argument mining in political debates.

work.name: CNRS
work.summary: Conducting PhD research in NLP, focusing on argument mining in political debates under the supervision of Serena Villata and Elena Cabrio.
highlights: Fallacy Detection and Repair in Political Discourse

work.name: CNRS
work.summary: Internship in argument mining and knowledge graph integration in political debate analysis, supervised by Serena Villata and Stefano Faralli.

work.name: Certimeter Group
work.summary: Worked on full-stack application development using Spring Boot for backend services and ReactJS for frontend interfaces.

work.name: Certimeter Group
work.summary: Contributed to full-stack projects, assisting in developing scalable web applications using modern Java and JavaScript frameworks.

teaching.summary: Delivered both lectures and lab sessions for the Data Analysis and Visualization course, covering topics such as exploratory data analysis, data cleaning, and interactive visualizations using Python.

teaching.position: Teaching Assistant – Natural Language Processing (Traitement du Langage Naturel)
teaching.summary: Led lab sessions for the NLP course, supporting both M2 MIAGE and L3 Informatique students with hands-on implementation of key NLP concepts and tools.

teaching.position: Guest Lecturer – Neural Networks and Backpropagation
teaching.summary: Delivered a theoretical lecture introducing the principles of neural networks and the backpropagation algorithm.

volunteer.summary: Assisted in organizing a scientific event focused on natural language-based argument analysis, generation, and reasoning.
Represented fellow students in academic and administrative matters within the college.

scholarships.title: Master's Thesis Abroad
scholarships.summary: Awarded to outstanding students for thesis development in international research environments.

scholarships.title: Erasmus+ Scholarship
scholarships.summary: Completed an exchange semester at Universidade do Porto, Portugal.

scholarships.title: Erasmus+ Scholarship
scholarships.summary: Completed an exchange semester at Universitatea Tehnică din Cluj-Napoca, Romania.

certificates.name: AWS Academy Cloud Foundations
certificates.issuer: Amazon Web Services Training and Certification

publications.name: Repairing Fallacious Argumentation in Political Debates
publications.summary: Proposed FallacyFix, a novel dataset and methodology for identifying and repairing fallacious argumentation in political discourse to enhance reasoning quality and combat misinformation.
